info.title: XchangeCrypt REST API Specification
info.description: TradingView REST API Specification for Brokers (ASP.NET Core 2.0)

get.description: Bars request. You can find examples in the [documentation](https://github.com/tradingview/charting_library/wiki/UDF#bars).

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: Symbol resolution. Possible resolutions are daily (`1D`, `2D` ... ), weekly (`1W`, `2W` ...), monthly (`1M`, `2M`...) and an intra-day resolution &ndash; minutes(`1`, `2` ...).

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Unix timestamp (UTC) of the leftmost required bar, including `from`.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Unix timestamp (UTC) of the rightmost required bar, including `to`.

parameters.name: countback
parameters.description: Number of bars (higher priority than `from`) starting with `to`. If `countback` is set, `from` should be ignorred. It is used only by tradingview.com, Trading Terminal will never use it.

200.description: Response is expected to be an object with properties listed below. Each property is treated as a table column

get.description: Stream of prices. Server constantly keeps the connection alive. If the connection is broken the server constantly tries to restore it. Transfer mode is 'chunked encoding'. The data feed should set 'Transfer-Encoding: chunked' and make sure that all intermediate proxies are set to use this mode. All messages are finished with '\\n'. Streaming data should contain real-time only. It shouldn't contain snapshots of data.

200.description: Data feed should provide ticks (trades, asks, bids) and daily bars.  If there is no trades the data feed should set trades to bids.  If there is only ask/bid implementation you must also set the trade (same as bid but it's size must be >= 1).  Size for trades is always >= 1 except for a correction. In case of correction size can be 0.  All times should be UNIX time UTC.  Daily bars are required if they cannot be built from ticks (has_dwm should be set to true in the symbol information).  Fields for asks, bids and trades: `id`, `p`, `s` (optional for asks and bids), `t`, `f`.  Fields for daily bars: `id`, `t`, `o`, `h`, `l`, `c`, `v`.  Messages: 1. trade `{\"id\":\"symbol\",\"p\":price,\"s\":size,\"t\":time}` 2. ask `{\"id\":\"symbol\",\"p\":price,\"s\":size,\"t\":time,\"f\":\"a\"}` 3. bid `{\"id\":\"symbol\",\"p\":price,\"s\":size,\"t\":time,\"f\":\"b\"}` 4. daily bar `{\"id\":\"symbol\",\"o\":open,\"h\":high,\"l\":low,\"c\":close,\"v\":volume,\"t\":time,\"f\":\"d\"}`

get.description: Get a list of all instruments
Get a list of executions (i.e. fills or trades) for an account and an instrument. Executions are displayed on a chart

parameters.name: maxCount
parameters.description: Maximum count of executions to return

get.description: Get a list of tradeable instruments that are available for trading with the account specified
Get pending orders for an account.

200.description: List of pending orders. It is also expected that broker returns orders filled/cancelled/rejected during current session.

parameters.name: instrument
parameters.description: Instrument to open the order on

parameters.name: qty
parameters.description: The number of units to open order for

parameters.name: limitPrice
parameters.description: Limit Price for Limit or StopLimit order

parameters.name: stopPrice
parameters.description: Stop Price for Stop or StopLimit order

parameters.name: durationDateTime
parameters.description: Expiration datetime UNIX timestamp (if supported by duration type)

200.description: Status. `message` should be filled if erroneous. `orderId` should present if successful.

get.description: Get order history for an account. It is expected that returned orders will have a final status (rejected, filled, cancelled). This request is optional. If you don't support history of orders set `AccountFlags::supportOrdersHistory` to `false`.

parameters.name: maxCount
parameters.description: Maximum amount of orders to return

get.description: Get an order for an account. It can be an active or historical order.

parameters.name: limitPrice
parameters.description: Limit Price for Limit or StopLimit order

parameters.name: stopPrice
parameters.description: Stop Price for Stop or StopLimit order

get.description: Get a position for an account

put.description: Modify an existing position stop loss or take profit or both

get.description: Get a list of accounts owned by the user

200.description: Access Token. TradingView will set Authorization header to 'Bearer ' + access_token for all requests with authorization.

get.description: Get current depth of market for the instrument. Optional.

Return all broker instruments with corresponding TradingView instruments. It is required to add a Broker to TradingView.com. It is not required for Trading Terminal integration. This request works without authorization!
Get current prices of the instrument. You can see an example of this response [here](https://demo_feed.tradingview.com/quotes?symbols=AAPL%2CMSFT%2CIBM%2CNasdaqNM%3AAAPL).
Request for bar marks (circles on top of bars). You can display custom marks only in the Trading Terminal

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: Symbol resolution. Possible resolutions are daily (`1D`, `2D` ... ), weekly (`1W`, `2W` ...), monthly (`1M`, `2M`...) and an intra-day resolution &ndash; minutes(`1`, `2` ...).

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Unix timestamp (UTC) of the leftmost required bar, including `from`.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Unix timestamp (UTC) of the rightmost required bar, including `to`.

200.description: Response is expected to be an object with properties listed below. Each property is an array

get.description: Request for timescale marks (circles on the timescale). You can display custom marks only in the Trading Terminal

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: Symbol resolution. Possible resolutions are daily (`1D`, `2D` ... ), weekly (`1W`, `2W` ...), monthly (`1M`, `2M`...) and an intra-day resolution &ndash; minutes(`1`, `2` ...).

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Unix timestamp (UTC) of the leftmost required bar, including `from`.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Unix timestamp (UTC) of the rightmost required bar, including `to`.

200.description: Response is expected to be an array.

get.summary: Receives all profile details related to an account of the authorized user.
Receives details of all wallets of the authorized user.
Receives details of a single specific wallet of the authorized user.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The account identifier. A unique symbol identification of a coin

post.summary: Requests a coin withdrawal from a specific wallet of the authorized user.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The account identifier. A unique symbol identification of a coin

parameters.name: recipientPublicKey
parameters.description: Recipient address of a wallet for coins to be sent to

parameters.name: withdrawalAmount
parameters.description: Amount of balance to withdraw, represented in multiplies of the lowest tradable amount, which is specified by the wallet

errmsg.description: Error message. Should be provided if s = \"error\"

nb.description: unix time of the next bar if there is no data (status code is no_data) in the requested period (optional)

t.description: bar time, unix timestamp (UTC). Daily bars should only have the date part, time should be 0.

f.description: Type (a - ask, b - bid, t - trade, d - daily bar). Default value is `t` (trade).

SymbolInfoArrays.description: SymbolInfo is an object containing symbols metadata. Each value of this object is an array of values which size is equal to symbols count or a single value that is applied to all symbols.

symbol.description: It's name of a symbol. It is a string which your users will see. Also, it will be used for data requests if you are not using tickers.

description.description: Description of a symbol. Will be printed in chart legend for this symbol.

exchange-listed.description: Short name of exchange where this symbol is listed

exchange-traded.description: Short name of exchange where this symbol is traded

minmov2.description: It's a number for complex price formatting cases

fractional.description: Boolean showing whether this symbol wants to have complex price formatting (see minmov2) or not

has-intraday.description: Boolean showing whether symbol has intraday (minutes) history data. If it's false then all buttons for intradays resolutions will be disabled when this symbol is active in chart. If it is set to true, all resolutions that are supplied directly by the datafeed must be provided in intraday_multipliers array.

has-no-volume.description: Boolean showing whether symbol has volume data or not

ticker.description: It's an unique identifier for this symbol in your symbology. If you specify this property then its value will be used for all data requests for this symbol. ticker is treated to be equal to symbol if not specified explicitly.

timezone.description: Exchange timezone for this symbol. We expect to get name of time zone in olsondb format

session-regular.description: Trading hours for this symbol. See the [Trading Sessions](https://github.com/tradingview/charting_library/wiki/Trading-Sessions) article to know more details.

supported-resolutions.description: An array of resolutions which should be enabled in resolutions picker for this symbol. Each item of an array is expected to be a string.

has-daily.description: The boolean value showing whether datafeed has its own D resolution bars or not. If has_daily = false then Charting Library will build respective resolutions from intraday by itself. If not, then it will request those bars from datafeed.

intraday-multipliers.description: It is an array containing intraday resolutions (in minutes) the datafeed wants to build by itself. E.g., if the datafeed reported he supports resolutions [\"1\", \"5\", \"15\"], but in fact it has only 1 minute bars for symbol X, it should set intraday_multipliers of X = [1]. This will make Charting Library to build 5 and 15 resolutions by itself.

has-weekly-and-monthly.description: The boolean value showing whether datafeed has its own W and M resolution bars or not. If has_weekly_and_monthly = false then Charting Library will build respective resolutions from D by itself. If not, then it will request those bars from datafeed.

pipSize.description: Size of 1 pip. It is equal to minTick for non-forex symbols. For forex pairs it equals either the minTick, or the minTick multiplied by 10. For example, for EURCAD minTick is 0.00001 and pipSize is 0.0001

pipValue.description: Value of 1 pip in account currency

instrument.description: Instrument name that is used on a broker's side

avgPrice.description: Average price of order fills. It should be provided for filled / partly filled orders.

limitPrice.description: Limit Price for Limit or StopLimit order.

stopPrice.description: Stop Price for Stop or StopLimit order.

parentId.description: Identifier of a parent order or a parent position (for position brackets) depending on `parentType`. Should be set only for bracket orders.

parentType.description: Type of order's parent. Should be set only for bracket orders.

status.description: String constants to describe an order status.  `Status`  | Description - -- -- -- -- -|- -- -- -- -- -- -- placing   | order is not created on a broker's side yet inactive  | bracket order is created but waiting for a base order to be filled working   | order is created but not executed yet rejected  | order is rejected for some reason filled    | order is fully executed cancelled  | order is cancelled

OrderDuration.description: Expiration type and UNIX timestamp date/time

type.description: Duration ID. Internal ID that you set in ConfigResponse.

instrument.description: Instrument name that is used on a broker's side

amData.description: Account Manager data. Structure of Account Manager is defined by `/config` response. Each element of this array is a table.

name.description: Account title that is displayed to a user

showQuantityInsteadOfAmount.description: Renames Amount to Quantity in the Order Ticket

supportDOM.description: Whether you want for DOM (Depth of market) widget to be available

supportBrackets.description: Whether you support brackets. Deprecated. Use supportOrderBrackets and supportPositionBrackets instead.

supportOrderBrackets.description: Whether you support adding (or modifying) stop loss and take profit to orders

supportPositionBrackets.description: Whether you support adding (or modifying) stop loss and take profit to positions

supportClosePosition.description: Whether you support closing of a position without a need for a user to fill an order. If it is `true` the Trading Terminal shows a confirmation dialog and sends a DELETE request instead of bringing up an order ticket.

supportEditAmount.description: Whether you support editing orders quantity. If you set it to `false`, the quantity control in the order ticket will be disabled when modifing an order.

supportLevel2Data.description: Whether you support Level 2 data. It is required to display DOM levels. You must implement `/streaming` to display DOM.

supportMultiposition.description: Whether you support multiple positions at one instrument at the same time

supportPLUpdate.description: Whether you provide `unrealizedPl` for positions. Otherwise P&L will be calculated automatically based on a simple algorithm

supportDigitalSignature.description: Whether you support Digital signature input field in the Order Ticket

access_token.description: Access token acts as a session ID that the application uses for making requests. This token should be protected as if it were user credentials

expiration.description: The time when the token is expired is represented as the number of seconds since the Unix epoch (00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970)

accountManager.description: Localized account manager's tables configuration. Account Manager is a page in the bottom widget. This page can have multiple tables. Data of the tables is filled using `/state` response.

durations.description: Localized array of durations displayed in Order Ticket

hasDatePicker.description: Display date control in Order Ticket for this duration type

hasTimePicker.description: Display time control in Order Ticket for this duration type

PullingInterval.description: Time intervals in milliseconds that Trading Terminal uses to pull data from the server

history.description: Time interval in milliseconds that Trading Terminal uses to request chart real-time bar udpates. Default value is 500 ms

quotes.description: Time interval in milliseconds that Trading Terminal uses to request quote udpates. Default value is 500 ms

orders.description: Time interval in milliseconds that Trading Terminal uses to request orders. Default value is 500 ms

positions.description: Time interval in milliseconds that Trading Terminal uses to request positions. Default value is 1000 ms

accountManager.description: Time interval in milliseconds that Trading Terminal uses to update Account Manager tables. Default value is 500 ms

tooltip.description: Tooltip that is shown on mouse hover

fixedWidth.description: Set it to true if data length is frequently changed

sortable.description: Set it to false if this columns data should not be sortable

Depth.description: Depth of market for an instrument

SymbolMapping.description: Map of Broker instrument names and TradingView instrument names

fields.description: Array with the only one element `['brokerSymbol']`.

SingleMapping.description: Map of Broker instrument name to TradingView instrument name

f.description: An array with the only one string element &ndash; broker symbol name

n.description: Symbol name. Should be equal to the requested one

chp.description: Change percent (displayed in Watch and Detail)

label.description: a letter to be printed on a mark. Single character

labelFontColor.description: color of a letter on a mark

label.description: A letter to be printed on a mark. Single character

WalletDetails.description: Details of a single wallet representing a balance of a single coin of one user.

coinSymbol.description: Short and unique coin name, used as a part of instrument trading pair name. Also used as account identifier.

walletPublicKey.description: Address to be used for receiving coins into the wallet.

balance.description: User balance of the wallet represented in multiplies of the lowest tradable amount, which is specified by the wallet.

Bearer.name: Authorization
Bearer.description: Please enter JWT with Bearer into field
